thread.title: Injured Evergreen football player dies at Harborview
thread.title_full: Injured Evergreen football player dies at Harborview

title: Injured Evergreen football player dies at Harborview
text:
Injured Evergreen football player dies at Harborview By JoNel AlecciaThe Seattle Times 
SEATTLE — A high school senior who suffered a critical injury late in a Friday night football game has died, an official at Harborview Medical Center said Monday. 
Kenney Bui, 17, succumbed shortly before noon Monday to unspecified injuries, said Susan Gregg, a hospital spokeswoman. Family members requested privacy. 
“He has a lot of friends who will support the family through this really hard time,” Gregg said. 
Bui was a student in the Highline Public School’s Technology, Engineering and Communication high school on the Evergreen campus, district officials said. 
He was among two high school students seriously injured in separate games Friday night. 
Adna senior David Young suffered a neck fracture and remains in satisfactory condition at Harborview, his stepfather said. 
Both injuries reportedly occurred while the players were making tackles. 
Bui was taken to Harborview by ambulance after being injured in the fourth quarter of a game against Highline High School at Highline Memorial Stadium. Both schools are in the Highline School District. 
Young’s team was playing against Napavine High School. Adna and Napavine are in Lewis County. Young was taken to a local hospital, then transferred to Harborview. 
Mike Colbrese, executive director of the Washington Interscholastic Activities Association, said the WIAA’s hearts and thoughts are with the family and the community. 
“We haven’t had injuries like this since 2009,” he said. 
That’s the year that Drew Swank, a 17-year-old football player from Spokane died after suffering a head injury in an early-season game. Rules for posting comments
